data: Complete the BC Children's Hospital Diabetic Ketoacidosis Protocol
Refer to BCCH Diabetic Ketoacidosis Nursing Protocol for DKA management guidelines
once, document and check urine for ketones
STAT if patient develops severe headache or alteration in vital signs or Glasgow Coma Scale Score
Insert large bore cannula on admission, STAT
Step 1: Fluid Resuscitation Bolus. T = 0 to 30 minutes from presentation  (BCCH DKA Protocol Lines 1 and 2 )
10 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute, drug form: bag, first dose priority: STAT
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute, drug form: bag, first dose priority: STAT
10 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag, first dose priority: STAT
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag, first dose priority: STAT
Step 2: Rehydration: T = 30 to 60 minutes from presentation. Begin Bag A (BCCH DKA Protocol Line 5)
Use BCCH DKA Protocol to determine rates for Bag A, B and C
Bag A: Initial Rehydration Fluid for 1 to 2 hour after Fluid Resuscitation. Rate determined by BCCH DKA Protocol Line 5
Bag A: Glucose Free (KCl in sodium chloride 0.9% )
KCl 40 mmol/L - sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) continuous infusion
mL/h, IV, order duration: 1 hour, drug form: bag
mL/h, IV, order duration: 2 hour, drug form: bag
Step 3:  T= 60 to 120 minutes after presentation: Begin 2-bag method (Bags A and B) and insulin infusion (Bag C) (BCCH DKA Protocol Lines 7, 8, 9)
insulin regular PED continuous infusion (0.1 unit/mL) NS standard
insulin regular PED continuous infusion (0.1 unit/mL) NS standard
insulin regular PED continuous infusion (0.1 unit/mL) NS standard
insulin regular PED continuous infusion (0.1 unit/mL) NS standard
2-Bag Method: Total rate of Bags A and B determined by BCCH DKA Protocol Line 8. Initially Bag A equals Line 8 Bag B equals 0 mL/h. Provider to enter start time in details tab
Bag A: Glucose Free (KCl in sodium chloride 0.9% )
Bag B: Glucose Containing (KCl in dextrose - sodium chloride 0.9% )
If dextrose 12.5% NaCL is not available, select dextrose 10% NaCL
Rate free text: Hang bag, rate 0 mL/h initially, IV, drug form: bag
Rate free text: Hang bag, rate 0 mL/h initially, IV, drug form: bag
Refer to BCCH DKA Recipes for dextrose reconstitution instructions
Whole Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Timed, Collection: T;N, q4h interval for 12 hour
Blood, Timed, Collection: T;N, q3h interval for 12 hour
Blood, Timed, Collection: T;N, q2h interval for 12 hour
Blood, Timed, Collection: T;N, q4h interval for 12 hour
